Description: Body sherd of Chian black figure Komast pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; dotted rosette in added white with added red centre between traces of red bands; exterior: from left, black-figure komast (only buttock and part of arm remaining) to left; at right, unclear motifs, perhaps furniture on a larger scale apparently than the komast.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the buttocks, see British Museum 1888,0601.548.c. The numbers 785, A837 (which are then crossed out) and A8296 are written in pencil on the interior surface of the sherd.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1244) (phase 2)
